about.name: Quebec City
about.info_text: Quebec City, often referred to as the 'Europe of North America,' is a charming and historic city in the Canadian province of Quebec. It is known for its well-preserved old town, stunning architecture, and a rich cultural heritage. Quebec City is a UNESCO World Heritage site and offers a unique blend of Old World charm and modern Canadian culture. Visitors can explore its cobblestone streets, enjoy the vibrant arts scene, and savor delicious French-inspired cuisine.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 531,000
Province: Quebec
Time Zone: Eastern Time Zone (UTC-05:00)
Language: French, English
Currency: Canadian dollar (CAD)
about.climate_text: Quebec City experiences four distinct seasons, with cold winters and warm summers. It's known for its picturesque snow-covered landscapes in the winter and colorful foliage in the fall, making it a year-round destination.

attractions_card.title: Old Quebec
attractions_card.description: Old Quebec is the heart of the city and a UNESCO World Heritage site, with historic buildings, narrow streets, and iconic landmarks like the Château Frontenac.

attractions_card.title: Château Frontenac
attractions_card.description: The Fairmont Le Château Frontenac is a historic and grand hotel that dominates the Quebec City skyline and offers stunning views of the St. Lawrence River.

attractions_card.title: Plains of Abraham
attractions_card.description: The Plains of Abraham is a historic battlefield park where the famous Battle of Quebec took place. It's now a peaceful urban park with walking trails and cultural events.

attractions_card.title: Montmorency Falls
attractions_card.description: Montmorency Falls is a breathtaking waterfall that's even taller than Niagara Falls. Visitors can take a cable car to the top or walk across the suspension bridge.

attractions_card.title: Citadelle of Quebec
attractions_card.description: The Citadelle is an active military installation and historic site. It's home to the Royal 22nd Regiment and offers guided tours of its fortifications.

attractions_card.title: Parliament Building
attractions_card.description: The Parliament Building is an impressive architectural gem and the seat of the National Assembly of Quebec. Guided tours provide insights into the province's government.

attractions_card.title: Museum of Civilization
attractions_card.description: The Museum of Civilization showcases Quebec's history and culture through interactive exhibits, art, and artifacts. It's an enlightening experience for visitors of all ages.

attractions_card.title: Old Port of Quebec
attractions_card.description: The Old Port is a picturesque area along the St. Lawrence River, with restaurants, shops, and recreational activities. It's a popular spot for both locals and tourists.

food_card.title: Poutine
food_card.description: Poutine is a Canadian delicacy, and Quebec City is a great place to enjoy it. It consists of French fries, cheese curds, and gravy, creating a delicious and satisfying dish.

food_card.title: Tourtière
food_card.description: Tourtière is a traditional French-Canadian meat pie, often enjoyed during the holiday season. It's a savory dish filled with spiced meat and encased in flaky pastry.

food_card.title: Maple Syrup
food_card.description: Quebec is known for its high-quality maple syrup. Visitors can taste this sweet treat on pancakes, waffles, and even in maple taffy served on snow.

food_card.title: Cider and Ice Cider
food_card.description: Quebec produces excellent apple ciders and ice ciders. Enjoy a glass of cider at local orchards or savor the unique flavors of ice cider.

food_card.title: Cretons
food_card.description: Cretons is a traditional Quebecois spread made from ground pork, onions, and spices. It's typically served on toast or crackers as a snack or breakfast.

hotels_card.title: Fairmont Le Château Frontenac
hotels_card.description: The Fairmont Le Château Frontenac is an iconic and luxurious hotel located in the heart of Old Quebec, offering opulent rooms and impeccable service.

hotels_card.title: Hôtel Le Germain Quebec
hotels_card.description: Hôtel Le Germain is a contemporary and stylish boutique hotel in Old Quebec, known for its elegant design and welcoming atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: Auberge Saint-Antoine
hotels_card.description: Auberge Saint-Antoine is a charming and historic hotel in Old Quebec, featuring comfortable accommodations and a focus on Quebec's heritage.

hotels_card.title: Hotel 71
hotels_card.description: Hotel 71 is a boutique hotel with a modern design and a prime location along the St. Lawrence River, providing picturesque views.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Manoir Victoria
hotels_card.description: Hotel Manoir Victoria is a well-established hotel in Old Quebec, offering comfortable rooms and easy access to the city's attractions.

transport_card.title: Quebec City Public Transit
transport_card.description: Quebec City has a public transit system that includes buses and ferries, providing convenient transportation within the city and its surroundings.

transport_card.alt: Quebec City Jean Lesage International Airport
transport_card.title: Quebec City Jean Lesage International Airport
transport_card.description: The Jean Lesage International Airport (YQB) serves Quebec City and offers domestic and international flights, connecting the city to various destinations.

transport_card.title: Walking and Biking
transport_card.description: Exploring Quebec City's historic district on foot is a popular choice due to its compact size. Biking is also a great way to see the city's sights.

transport_card.title: Car Rentals
transport_card.description: Car rental services are available for those who want to explore the greater Quebec City region and its scenic surroundings at their own pace.
